result.execSummary:
The defendant Nigel A Epps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Pay restitution in the amount of $317.00 payable to Walgreens Corporation.

*Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
*If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of wages/earnings.
*Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the agent.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
*Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*No contact with the victim Dina S. or the Walgreens at 2950 N. Oakland Avenue. Defendant may have contact with the victim for purposes of Restorative Justice if approved by the victim.
*Commit no new crimes.

*Attend parenting class.
*Provide prescriptions to agent before filling the prescription.

*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: *Defendant to report to the House of Correction on 12/04/15 by 10:00 a.m. *Defendant may have release for work with proof of employment. If the defendant is not employed, he is eligible for the Day Reporting Center with participation in vocational/educational programming. Defendant may have release for school with proof of enrollment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nigel A Epps

defendant.name: Epps, Nigel A

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DENYING Request for Good Time Credit signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.
Bail Refund Packet
Restitution Packets
12/9/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. State requested a short adjournment to allow the victim to submit a written impact statement. Defense does not object. Court granted State's request. PSI reviewed by the parties. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution information received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Court reviewed the violation report received on 11/04/15 and will address the violation on the next court date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Violation report - missed telephone contact - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Court vacated the jury trial date of 9/21/15. 
Defendant to bring proof of employment and enrollment in school to the next court date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. State made oral motion to amend the Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Robbery (Threat of Force), contrary to sec. 943.32(1)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties contacted the Court requesting a plea date prior to the jury trial. Case adjourned to 9/17/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Plea Hearing in Branch 25. Deputy Court clerk ccp.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties remain in a trial posture. Defense counsel will not be challenging the admissibility of the defendant's statements to police. Court will conduct a colloquy with the defendant regarding this waiver on the day of trial. State placed offer on the record. Case remain scheduled for jury trial on 9/21/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed Verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Motions in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel contacted the court requesting a short adjournment of the final pretrial date due to scheduling issues. State notified and does not object. Case rescheduled to 9/01/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Final Pretrial in Branch 25. Defense counsel to notify the defendant of the new court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties advise the Court they have not reached a resolution in this matter. Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Discussion regarding Justice Point violation report. Court admonished the defendant to comply with conditions of Justice Point monitoring. Parties to file motions by 8/17/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Clerk advised by Justice Point the defendant is now in compliance. Court will address the violation on the next court date. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report  Violation report - missed telephone contact - received and filed. Court ordered this matter be set for a hearing. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing.  The parties have not reached a resolution, but negotiations are still on-going.  The Court granted an additional plea date instead of setting final pre-trial and jury trial dates. All conditions of bail remain the same. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  All parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 case will be reassigned to Branch 25, Judge Stephanie Rothstein, in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another plea date to determine defendant's eligibility for drug treatment court.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail and granted request for new date.  All terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Case is continued for scheduling before Branch 20 on 6/24/15 at 1:30 p.m., the date previously selected with ADA Daugherty and Attorney Levine.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Case is rescheduled for another scheduling date; State provided defense counsel with additional discovery and defense counsel needs time to go over same with defendant.  Branch 20 is not in session on 6/11/15, but defendant is required to appear to sign off on the Agreed Upon Request for New Date form.  Parties select 6/24/15 at 1:30 p.m.`
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Patricia I. Daugherty for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel's request for another scheduling date was granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling before Branch 20 and ordered that all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Danielle Chojnacki for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Case was incorrectly assigned.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM024427  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/12/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WALGREENS AND DINA S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nigel A Epps in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Nigel A Epps in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial REport dated 5/15/15.
